metadata.synopsis: 6 months have passed since the Netherbrain was destroyed. Withers has orginized an evening for our heroes to come together once agrain from across the realms. GROUP_Players 11 is reservered for romance partners. Used for cine staging, but also used for checking for avatar Karlach branch who went to hell with their partner.

5.speaker: Narrator
5.text: *Six months have passed since you defeated the Netherbrain, and since then you have seen more of life than you ever thought possible.*

25.speaker: Narrator
25.text: *You are greeted as a saviour, a champion, a hero... but sometimes you feel like something else entirely. An adventurer, a traveller, a survivor.*

284.speaker: Narrator
284.text: *You faced down the gods, you thwarted the Grand Design - anything seems possible.*

248.speaker: Narrator
248.text: *But before you can write the next chapter of your story, you must end this one.*

92.speaker: Narrator
92.text: *That's why you're going back to where all of this began, answering an invitation from a familiar friend.*

4.speaker: Narrator
4.text: *That's why you're going back to where all of this began, answering an invitation to gather with your allies and friends.*

210.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Wide shot of party members placed around the campfire. Withers at centre. Any party members who enter in the following nodes are missing. That is:

1) Lae'zel on Vlaakith path
2) Karlach,
3) Wyll on Avernus path.
4) Gale on god path.

228.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel manifests in camp as a holographic projection

32.context: CinematicNodeContext: A portal from Avernus opens in the camp - Karlach and Wyll step out together

78.context: NodeContext: A portal from Avernus opens in the camp - Wyll steps out

231.speaker: Withers
231.text: Thou hast arrived. Some call you 'saviour'. Others, 'adventurer' - or 'adversary'.

285.speaker: Withers
285.text: But under this night's sky, upon familiar ground, thou mayest simply be called 'friend'.

14.speaker: Withers
14.text: Cladden with love, thou sundered the greater evils that attempted to rot away this realm.

286.speaker: Withers
286.text: Take rest, as no quill will record thy steps tonight, nor any god rally thy duty.

115.speaker: Withers
115.text: Go, dine, and delight in the music filling the air.

270.speaker: Withers
270.text: Though the weight of the realms were great, thy shoulders bore them admirably.

106.speaker: Withers
106.text: Thou wert called here. Some from above, some below.

2.speaker: Withers
2.text: For with thine bond, together thou hast kept the Wheel of Fate spinning, when it threatened to halt.

46.speaker: Withers
46.text: Though thou wert drawn far apart in the months after the collapse of the Absolute.

68.speaker: Withers
68.text: Tonight, Fate renews thy bond once more. Thou shouldst take care to preserve it - it is a great weapon, wielded in the hand of good.

253.speaker: Withers
253.text: Go. Know one another once more.

7.speaker: Narrator
7.text: *One among you could not truly attend, but the pull of Withers' magic called you still. Listen and enjoy, though you'll be little more than a breeze ruffling your companions' hair.*
7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Focus on the wisp/projection player

82.context: CinematicNodeContext: A portal from Avernus opens in the camp - Karlach steps out

18.speaker: Narrator
18.text: *You have made a fortress in the Underdark, along with other outcast vampire spawn. It is not civilised, it is not safe, but it is home.*

230.speaker: Narrator
230.text: *Few know how to find you, and most that do are unwelcome, so when a message addressed to you arrives, you fear the worst.*

57.speaker: Narrator
57.text: *Hunters, killers, tormentors. But you need not fear - this letter is an invitation, and it comes from a friend.*

237.speaker: Narrator
237.text: *Written in a frail hand, it requests your presence at celebration for those who stood against the Absolute.*

58.speaker: Narrator
58.text: *Written in a frail hand, it requests your presence at a gathering of your former allies. Those who stood with you against the Absolute.*

26.speaker: Narrator
26.text: *When the invitation came, you were hip-deep in lemure slime, swarmed by hellwasps, and about to drive the killing blow on a magma claw.*

36.speaker: Narrator
36.text: *Cutting through the dreadful buzz of the wasps and the screams of the damned, a familiar, comforting voice echoed in your mind - Withers.*

35.speaker: Narrator
35.text: *He requested your attendance in Faerun, to gather with your friends and allies, those who stood against the Absolute at your side.*

67.speaker: Narrator
67.text: *He requested your attendance in Faerun, to gather with your friends and allies, those who stood against the Absolute at your side.*

31.speaker: Narrator
31.text: *Six months from the fall of the Netherbrain, you and Astarion were hosting a grand masquerade in the refurbished ballroom of Cazador's Palace.*

165.speaker: Narrator
165.text: *A young elf wearing an ivory mask in the guise of a skinless skull handed you a note as he passed you in the crowd.*

240.speaker: Narrator
240.text: *An invitation, written in a frail hand, inviting you to a celebration for those who stood against the Absolute.*

10.speaker: Narrator
10.text: *As it is, you'll gather in a familiar place, and one altogether more suitable for such joyful reflection.*

258.speaker: Narrator
258.text: *An invitation, written in a frail hand, inviting you to a gathering of the friends and allies who stood with you against the Absolute.*

140.speaker: Narrator
140.text: *Astarion pouted when you read the invitation to him. He'd gladly accompany you, but he would have been happy to host the party himself.*

183.speaker: Narrator
183.text: *As it is, you'll gather in a familiar place, and one altogether more suitable for your reunion.*

45.speaker: Narrator
45.text: *You and Shadowheart found your peace, in a country farmstead with a pack of pets, and a garden of night orchids.*

124.speaker: Narrator
124.text: *You are basking beneath the silver moon after a midnight swim one night, when you notice a letter among your discarded clothes.*

43.speaker: Narrator
43.text: *An invitation to a celebration for those who stood against the Absolute.*

206.speaker: Narrator
206.text: *You waste no time in packing, and set off on the long road back to where all of your adventures began.*

200.speaker: Narrator
200.text: *An invitation to a gathering of the friends and allies who stood by your side in the fight against the Absolute.*

288.speaker: Narrator
288.text: *You waste no time in packing, and set off on the long road back to where all of your adventures together began.*

47.speaker: Narrator
47.text: *While navigating the disordered environs of Limbo, you and Lae'zel heard the summons.*

142.speaker: Narrator
142.text: *A telepathic emanation. You are accustomed to receiving dispatches and battle orders from the githyanki rebel forces in this form, but this was different.*

157.speaker: Narrator
157.text: *An invitation to a celebration, for those who stood against the Netherbrain, those who thwarted the Grand Design.*

20.speaker: Narrator
20.text: *The victory that enabled the war against Vlaakith's tyranny. You cannot be there in person, but you shall be there nonetheless.*

227.speaker: Narrator
227.text: *An invitation to a gathering of friends. Those allies who stood with you against the Netherbrain, those who thwarted the Grand Design.*

116.speaker: Narrator
116.text: *Those who made your war against Vlaakith's tyranny possible. You cannot join them in person, but you shall be with them again nonetheless.*

244.speaker: Narrator
244.text: *To project your image through the cosmos... Such is the skill of the Prince of the Comet. You have no doubt it can be done.*

218.speaker: Narrator
218.text: *To project your image through the cosmos... it can be done, with the aid of your allies, the mages of Xamvadi'm.*

48.speaker: Narrator
48.text: *Six months from the fall of the Netherbrain, you were hosting a grand masquerade in the refurbished ballroom of Cazador's Palace.*

190.speaker: Narrator
190.text: *A young elf wearing an ivory mask in the guise of a skinless skull handed you a note as he passed you in the crowd.*

268.speaker: Narrator
268.text: *An invitation, written in a frail hand, inviting you to a celebration for those who stood against the Absolute.*

187.speaker: Narrator
187.text: *An invitation, written in a frail hand, inviting you to a gathering of the friends and allies who stood with you against the Absolute.*

93.speaker: Narrator
93.text: *You'll attend this little party, of course, but how appalling that they didn't ask you to be the host. It would have been spectacular.*

49.speaker: Narrator
49.text: *When the invitation came, you were hip-deep in lemure slime, swarmed by hellwasps, and about to drive the killing blow on a magma claw.*

272.speaker: Narrator
272.text: *Cutting through the dreadful buzz of the wasps and the screams of the damned, a familiar, comforting voice echoed in your mind - Withers.*

224.speaker: Narrator
224.text: *He requested your attendance in Faerun, to gather with your friends and allies, those who stood against the Absolute at your side.*

130.speaker: Narrator
130.text: *He requested your attendance in Faerun, to gather with your friends and allies, those who stood against the Absolute at your side.*

61.speaker: Narrator
61.text: *You and Gale have travelled long and far, seeking out knowledge and adventure in the hidden places of the world.*

73.speaker: Narrator
73.text: *Sometimes it isn't clear if he loves the wonderful places his curiosity leads him to more than he loves you.*

16.speaker: Narrator
16.text: *But whenever he looks into your eyes, or up at the stars while he sits by your side, you know the answer.*

202.speaker: Narrator
202.text: *One such night, your reveries are interrupted by an embarrassed courier, delivering an urgent message, written in a frail hand. An invitation.*

184.speaker: Narrator
184.text: *The location is familiar, and though the road is hard and long, you would not miss this for the world.*

72.speaker: Narrator
72.text: *Since the Netherbrain fell, you and Shadowheart have seen more of Faerûn than you ever thought possible.*
72.context: CinematicNodeContext: Black screenInternalNodeContext: Note: not with Sharran SH

234.speaker: Narrator
234.text: *She no longer shies from wolves or water - nothing in the world frightens her anymore, and you feel you could face anything by her side.*

51.speaker: Narrator
51.text: *One day, you receive a letter, passed to you by a stranger who bows with deference.*

80.speaker: Narrator
80.text: *You are Lae'zel of K'liir - and yet, you are not. You are an ascended soul, Vlaakith's favoured - yet nothing but a mote floating between planes.*
80.context: CinematicNodeContext: Begin campfire sequence.  Lae'zel is a ghostly wisp.NodeContext: Mysteriously.

96.speaker: Narrator
96.text: *You and Gale have made a home for yourselves in Waterdeep. Sometimes it isn't clear what he loves more - his research, or you.*

37.speaker: Narrator
37.text: *But whenever he looks into your eyes, or up at the stars while he sits by your side, you know the answer.*

207.speaker: Narrator
207.text: *One such night, your reveries are interrupted by an embarrassed apprentice, delivering an urgent message, written in a frail hand.*

12.speaker: Narrator
12.text: *An invitation to a celebration, for those who stood against the Netherbrain, those who thwarted the Grand Design.*

201.speaker: Narrator
201.text: *Gale the adventurer has quickly become Gale the academic, but he is all-too happy to leave his tower for this meeting.*

221.speaker: Narrator
221.text: *An invitation to a gathering of former allies - those who stood with you against the Netherbrain six months ago.*

108.speaker: Narrator
108.text: *Gale the adventurer has quickly become Gale the academic, but he is all-too happy to leave his tower for this meeting.*

97.speaker: Narrator
97.text: *In the six months since the Netherbrain fell, you have not seen Baldur's Gate. You only look forward, to the next horizon.*

271.speaker: Narrator
271.text: *You were dining with folk on some nameless frontier when the invitation came to you - an invitation to look back to where all of this began.*

276.speaker: Narrator
276.text: *It was an invitation you could not turn down, for tonight, you will celebrate all who stood against the Absolute.*

212.speaker: Narrator
212.text: *It was an invitation you could not turn down, for tonight, you will gather with the friends and allies who stood with you against the Absolute.*

101.speaker: Narrator
101.text: *While navigating the disordered environs of Limbo, you and Lae'zel heard the summons.*

160.speaker: Narrator
160.text: *A telepathic emanation. You are accustomed to receiving dispatches and battle orders from the githyanki rebel forces in this form, but this was different.*

38.speaker: Narrator
38.text: *An invitation to a celebration, for those who stood against the Netherbrain, those who thwarted the Grand Design.*

259.speaker: Narrator
259.text: *The victory that enabled the war against Vlaakith's tyranny. You cannot be there in person, but you shall be there nonetheless.*

181.speaker: Narrator
181.text: *An invitation to a gathering of friends. Those allies who stood with you against the Netherbrain, those who thwarted the Grand Design.*

59.speaker: Narrator
59.text: *Those who made your war against Vlaakith's tyranny possible. You cannot join them in person, but you shall be with them again nonetheless.*

238.speaker: Narrator
238.text: *To project your image through the cosmos... Such is the skill of the Prince of the Comet. You have no doubt it can be done.*

39.speaker: Narrator
39.text: *To project your image through the cosmos... it can be done, with the aid of your allies, the mages of Xamvadi'm.*

117.speaker: Narrator
117.text: *Since the Netherbrain fell, you and Astarion have seen more of Faerûn than you ever thought possible.*

121.speaker: Narrator
121.text: *One night, he tells you that these last six months of happy memories are the counterweight to two hundred years of misery.*

254.speaker: Narrator
254.text: *The next day you receive an invitation, written in a frail hand, inviting you to a gathering, back in the place where your journey together began.*

110.speaker: Narrator
110.text: *A chance to relax and reflect on your triumph over the Absolute.*

241.speaker: Narrator
241.text: *A chance to meet with the friends and allies who were by your side in the battle against the Absolute.*

119.speaker: Narrator
119.text: *In the six months since the Netherbrain fell, you have seen more of Faerûn than you ever thought possible.*

64.speaker: Narrator
64.text: *By day, you protect those who need protection, and by night you pray to the Moonmaiden, and ask for her guidance.*

9.speaker: Narrator
9.text: *She always listens, and she always replies, leading you to new adventures and enlightenment.*

292.speaker: Narrator
292.text: *Tonight you have deviated from the course she sets, if only for a moment, to follow another path.*

145.speaker: Narrator
145.text: *A courier found you and delivered a letter addressed to 'Shadowheart', a name few call you anymore.*

120.speaker: Narrator
120.text: *While navigating the disordered environs of Limbo, you heard the summons.*

136.speaker: Narrator
136.text: *An invitation to a celebration, for those who stood against the Netherbrain, those who thwarted the Grand Design.*

15.speaker: Narrator
15.text: *The victory that enabled the war against Vlaakith's tyranny. You cannot be there in person, but you shall be there nonetheless.*

186.speaker: Narrator
186.text: *An invitation to a gathering of friends. Those allies who stood with you against the Netherbrain, those who thwarted the Grand Design.*

189.speaker: Narrator
189.text: *Those who made your war against Vlaakith's tyranny possible. You cannot join them in person, but you shall be with them again nonetheless.*

222.speaker: Narrator
222.text: *As the Prince of the Comet's favoured sword, you need only request his aid to project your visage through the cosmos and it is done.*

261.speaker: Narrator
261.text: *You command great respect within the rebel army. The allied mages of Xamvadi'm are employed to project your image through the cosmos, back to Faerûn.*

122.speaker: Narrator
122.text: *Six months since you faced your father and refused your birthright. Six months since you cured yourself of the Urge.*

95.speaker: Narrator
95.text: *Six months since you sacrificed it all; rebirthed into something new, something superior.*

3.speaker: Narrator
3.text: *Your life is your own now, and you are already becoming someone new.*

91.speaker: Narrator
91.text: *But the memories of the past will not leave you alone - you receive an invitation one day, in a hand you recognise immediately.*

150.speaker: Narrator
150.text: *'Challenger of Gods,' it reads. 'Surely thou wishest to reflect and ruminate? To breathe free and familiar air?'*

159.speaker: Narrator
159.text: *Withers, who raised you when your father struck you down. He bids you to join him at a celebration.*

24.speaker: Narrator
24.text: *So once again you return to the place where you formed your first memories.*

55.speaker: Narrator
55.text: *You are calm. You are you. You can do this.*

123.speaker: Narrator
123.text: *'Challenger of Gods,' it reads. 'Surely thou wishest to see thine true family, once more?'*

170.speaker: Narrator
170.text: *Withers, who raised you when your father struck you down. He bids you join him at a gathering of your allies and friends.*

13.speaker: Narrator
13.text: *Cutting through the dreadful buzz of the wasps and the screams of the damned, a familiar, comforting voice echoed in your mind - Withers.*

249.speaker: Narrator
249.text: *He requested your attendance in Faerun - a chance to reflect on your triumph over the Absolute.*

211.speaker: Narrator
211.text: *He requested your attendance in Faerun, to gather with your friends and allies, those who stood against the Absolute at your side.*

195.speaker: Narrator
195.text: *The overbearing heat, the ever-looming threat of Zariel's forces - you've been seeking any chance for respite.*

257.speaker: Narrator
257.text: *It was hardly a tenday ago that you and Wyll finally confronted Mizora, and you've been searching for a way out of Avernus ever since.*

137.speaker: Narrator
137.text: *When the invitation came, you were hip-deep in lemure slime, swarmed by hellwasps, and about to drive the killing blow on a magma claw.*

282.speaker: Narrator
282.text: *Cutting through the dreadful buzz of the wasps and the screams of the damned, a familiar, comforting voice echoed in your mind - Withers.*

197.speaker: Narrator
197.text: *He requested your attendance in Faerun - a chance to reflect on your triumph over the Absolute.*

290.speaker: Narrator
290.text: *A reprieve from the Blood War, a few hours of respite with the stars above.*

243.speaker: Narrator
243.text: *Karlach's heart can take the strain of leaving Avernus for a short time, but it might burst with joy to feel the comforts of home, if just for an evening.*

196.speaker: Narrator
196.text: *He requested your attendance in Faerun, to gather with your friends and allies, those who stood against the Absolute at your side.*

90.speaker: Narrator
90.text: *A reprieve from the Blood War, a few hours of respite with the stars above, and good company to cheer you.*

193.speaker: Narrator
193.text: *Karlach's heart can take the strain of leaving Avernus for a few short hours, but it might burst with joy to see those friends again.*

139.speaker: Narrator
139.text: *It has been six months since the Netherbrain fell... six months since you and Wyll last saw Baldur's Gate.*

242.speaker: Narrator
242.text: *Since then, you have seen more of Faerûn than you ever thought possible, and there is always a fresh horizon to chase.*

114.speaker: Narrator
114.text: *But one day, at a distant frontier that did not even have a name, you received a letter - a reason to look back.*

0.speaker: Narrator
0.text: *An invitation to a celebration for those who stood against the Absolute.*

34.speaker: Narrator
34.text: *The gathering will not be in the city that you saved though. It will be where your adventures first began.*

232.speaker: Narrator
232.text: *An invitation to a gathering of your friends and allies, those who stood with you against the Absolute.*

105.speaker: Narrator
105.text: *The gathering will not be in the city that you saved though. It will be where your adventures together began.*

143.speaker: Narrator
143.text: *In the six months since the Netherbrain fell, you have often doubted the decisions that led you to the depths of the Underdark.*

84.speaker: Narrator
84.text: *Here, there is little comfort, there is only conflict, danger, and war against impossible odds. But there is also joy.*

191.speaker: Narrator
191.text: *Even though your camps are haunted by scuttling spiders and Lolthsworn soldiers, when you lie with Minthara you feel like you could tear down the world.*

214.speaker: Narrator
214.text: *And you are building an army of your own - the outcasts, the exiles and the rebels flock to your cause.*

33.speaker: Narrator
33.text: *Now, you must leave them for a brief while, and return to the surface, for you have received an invitation to celebrate upon familiar grounds.*

76.speaker: Narrator
76.text: *Now, you must leave them for a brief while, and return to the surface, for you have received an invitation to meet with friends and allies once more.*

107.speaker: Narrator
107.text: *Since the Netherbrain fell, you have continued to evolve. Thought is action, action is thought, speech is... difficult.*

30.speaker: Narrator
30.text: *Your mind has voyaged to the limits of existence, communing with entities unique and wondrous, but something always calls it back.*

267.speaker: Narrator
267.text: *Back to Faerûn, back to your self, back to the beginning. The time before you became what you are, when your tadpole first sang in your mind.*

245.speaker: Narrator
245.text: *You are back there once again when a voice comes to you - Withers, who you know so well. It is time, he says, to reflect and reminisce.*

277.speaker: Narrator
277.text: *An invitation your burgeoning curiosity cannot allow you to decline.*

128.speaker: Narrator
128.text: *You are back there once again when a voice comes to you - Withers, who you know so well. It is time, he says, to meet with your allies once again.*

182.speaker: Narrator
182.text: *You dream of them often, and now you will see if your dreams have become their reality.*

262.speaker: Narrator
262.text: *Cutting through the dreadful buzz of the wasps and the screams of the damned, a familiar, comforting voice echoed in your mind - Withers.*

75.speaker: Narrator
75.text: *He requested your attendance in Faerun - a chance to reflect on your triumph over the Absolute.*

264.speaker: Narrator
264.text: *A reprieve from the Blood War, a few hours of respite with the stars above.*

87.speaker: Narrator
87.text: *Your heart can take the strain of leaving Avernus for a short time, but it might burst with joy to feel the comforts of home, if just for an evening.*

22.speaker: Narrator
22.text: *He requested your attendance in Faerun, to gather with your friends and allies, those who stood against the Absolute at your side.*

100.speaker: Narrator
100.text: *A reprieve from the Blood War, a few hours of respite with the stars above, and good company to cheer you.*

169.speaker: Narrator
169.text: *Your heart can take the strain of leaving Avernus for a few short hours, but it might burst with joy to see those friends again.*
169.context: InternalNodeContext: inclusion from the companion who went to Avernus with Karlach

158.speaker: Narrator
158.text: *When the invitation came, you were hip-deep in lemure slime, swarmed by hellwasps, and about to drive the killing blow on a magma claw.*

171.speaker: Narrator
171.text: *Cutting through the dreadful buzz of the wasps and the screams of the damned, a familiar, comforting voice echoed in your mind - Withers.*

19.speaker: Narrator
19.text: *He requested your attendance in Faerun - a chance to reflect on your triumph over the Absolute.*

162.speaker: Narrator
162.text: *A reprieve from the Blood War, a few hours of respite with the stars above.*

250.speaker: Narrator
250.text: *Karlach's heart can take the strain of leaving Avernus for a short time, but it might burst with joy to feel the comforts of home, if just for an evening.*

175.speaker: Narrator
175.text: *He requested your attendance in Faerun, to gather with your friends and allies, those who stood against the Absolute at your side.*

152.speaker: Narrator
152.text: *A reprieve from the Blood War, a few hours of respite with the stars above, and good company to cheer you.*

141.speaker: Narrator
141.text: *Karlach's heart can take the strain of leaving Avernus for a few short hours, but it might burst with joy to see those friends again.*

161.speaker: Narrator
161.text: *Time has passed since you claimed your godhood, but you cannot say how much. A day, a month, a year, a century?*

225.speaker: Narrator
225.text: *You measure time in aeons and eternities, and space is a matter of infinities, overlapping impossibly in the dreams of the divine.*

69.speaker: Narrator
69.text: *But the virtues of immortality are as undeniable as they are limitless.*

213.speaker: Narrator
213.text: *That is why you must return once more to Faerûn, where the Netherbrain fell - and where your ambition was first sparked.*

56.speaker: Narrator
56.text: *Perhaps there you might learn how much time has passed since you last graced the planes as a mortal man.*

65.speaker: Narrator
65.text: *But the bonds of friendship and heroism still have meaning, and they are truly without limit.*

204.speaker: Narrator
204.text: *That is why you must return once more to Faerûn, to be with those who stood alongside you when the Netherbrain fell.*

89.speaker: Narrator
89.text: *To be among mortals once more. The best of their kind.*

88.speaker: Narrator
88.text: *Perhaps they can tell you how much time has passed since the last time you were together.*

166.speaker: Narrator
166.text: *In the six months since the Netherbrain fell, you and Minthara have set so many schemes in motion that it is hard to keep track of them.*

163.speaker: Narrator
163.text: *They are all interwoven to create one grand plot, ensuring everyone of importance in the city owes you a favour, a debt, or their life.*

153.speaker: Narrator
153.text: *Minthara is happier here than you could ever have imagined, and she fully intends to rule the city one day, from the shadows, with you at her side.*

109.speaker: Narrator
109.text: *But now you must leave, not on a matter of business or intrigue, but for pleasure.*

74.speaker: Narrator
74.text: *You are invited to a celebration in honour of those who stood against the Absolute.*

289.speaker: Narrator
289.text: *The allies who stood with you against the Absolute are gathering, and you are invited.*

172.speaker: Narrator
172.text: *Your cloister is strong, your faith is stronger, but you have barely slept since the Netherbrain fell, half a year ago.*

205.speaker: Narrator
205.text: *There are few you can trust, and you watch all those who serve you and the Lady of Night closely.*

102.speaker: Narrator
102.text: *Shar will protect you from their whispers and conspiracies. She loves you. She must.*

113.speaker: Narrator
113.text: *There are others who you can trust - Withers among them. He is organising a celebration, back where your adventure began, and you have been invited.*

135.speaker: Narrator
135.text: *You slipped away from the cloister - you would not dream of missing such an evening of reflectiion.*

252.speaker: Narrator
252.text: *There are others who you can trust. Those who stood with you against the Absolute. Friends, allies, accomplices.*

217.speaker: Narrator
217.text: *They are gathering, back where your adventure began, and you have been invited. You slipped away from the cloister to be with them once more.*

174.speaker: Narrator
174.text: *You feared the worst when the messenger found you. Cazador's minions are ever-watchful, and you thought they had caught you at last.*

111.speaker: Narrator
111.text: *But you had nothing to fear. This was one message you were glad to receive - an invitation from a friend.*

94.speaker: Narrator
94.text: *Withers is holding a celebration for those who stood against the Absolute.*

77.speaker: Narrator
77.text: *An opportunity for closure, if not joyful reverie.*

23.speaker: Narrator
23.text: *But you had nothing to fear. This was the one message you had hoped to receive - an invitation to meet with your friends and allies.*

219.speaker: Narrator
219.text: *Those who stood with you against the Absolute. Those you were parted from so suddenly when the victory was won.*

71.speaker: Narrator
71.text: *Now you have a chance to say goodbye.*

176.speaker: Narrator
176.text: *You feared the worst when the messenger found you. Few know your name, or where you rest while the tyrant sun is in the sky.*

194.speaker: Narrator
194.text: *For six months, Lae'zel has been learning the ways of Faerûn by your side, as you travelled together far and wide.*

154.speaker: Narrator
154.text: *A letter written in a frail hand interrupted your adventures.*

255.speaker: Narrator
255.text: *An invitation to a celebration, for those who stood against the Netherbrain, those who thwarted the Grand Design.*

131.speaker: Narrator
131.text: *The location is familiar, and though the road is hard and long, you would not miss this for the world.*

291.speaker: Narrator
291.text: *An invitation to a gathering of former allies - those who stood with you against the Netherbrain six months ago.*

149.speaker: Narrator
149.text: *Cutting through the dreadful buzz of the wasps and the screams of the damned, a familiar, comforting voice echoed in your mind - Withers.*

129.speaker: Narrator
129.text: *He requested your attendance in Faerun - a chance to reflect on your triumph over the Absolute.*

263.speaker: Narrator
263.text: *A reprieve from the Blood War, a few hours of respite with the stars above.*

6.speaker: Narrator
6.text: *Your heart can take the strain of leaving Avernus for a short time, but it might burst with joy to feel the comforts of home, if just for an evening.*

103.speaker: Narrator
103.text: *He requested your attendance in Faerun, to gather with your friends and allies, those who stood against the Absolute at your side.*

180.speaker: Narrator
180.text: *A reprieve from the Blood War, a few hours of respite with the stars above, and good company to cheer you.*

251.speaker: Narrator
251.text: *Your heart can take the strain of leaving Avernus for a few short hours, but it might burst with joy to see those friends again.*
251.context: InternalNodeContext: inclusion from the companion who went to Avernus with Karlach

209.speaker: Narrator
209.text: *When the invitation came, you were hip-deep in lemure slime, swarmed by hellwasps, and about to drive the killing blow on a magma claw.*

133.speaker: Narrator
133.text: *Cutting through the dreadful buzz of the wasps and the screams of the damned, a familiar, comforting voice echoed in your mind - Withers.*

256.speaker: Narrator
256.text: *He requested your attendance in Faerun - a chance to reflect on your triumph over the Absolute.*

28.speaker: Narrator
28.text: *He requested your attendance in Faerun, to gather with your friends and allies, those who stood against the Absolute at your side.*

215.speaker: Narrator
215.text: *You returned to Waterdeep shortly after the Netherbrain fell, and almost half a year has passed since you took up residence in your tower.*

275.speaker: Narrator
275.text: *It has been bliss. Your library grows by the day, as your status as a saviour of the Sword Coast brings visitors and tributes from every corner of Faerûn.*

233.speaker: Narrator
233.text: *Rare is the interruption that can drag you from your studies, but an invitation written in a frail hand does precisely that.*

148.speaker: Narrator
148.text: *It is a request to join a celebration for those who stood against the Absolute.*

279.speaker: Narrator
279.text: *It is a request to join a gathering of your friends and allies, those who stood with you against the Absolute.*

223.speaker: Narrator
223.text: *Halsin was eager to leave the city after the Netherbrain fell, although you remained for a tenday to help the wounded.*

247.speaker: Narrator
247.text: *Some of them accompanied you when you left. Their homes were rubble, and the promise of a sanctuary sheltered from the city was appealing.*

216.speaker: Narrator
216.text: *They helped to build the place you now call home, hidden from those who are not welcome, open to any who need shelter.*

1.speaker: Narrator
1.text: *One day, Halsin returns from a patrol of the borders with a letter held in his jaw. You read it to him, as you scratch behind his ear.*

199.speaker: Narrator
199.text: *An invitation to a celebration for those who stood against the Absolute.*

40.speaker: Narrator
40.text: *An invitation to a gathering of your friends and allies, those who stood with you against the Absolute.*

132.speaker: Narrator
132.text: *The gathering will not be in the city that you saved though. It will be where your adventures together began.*

226.speaker: Narrator
226.text: *In the six months since the Netherbrain fell, you have tended to your family on the farmstead you call home.*

62.speaker: Narrator
62.text: *You do not know how long it will last, or what will come next, but it is a good life, and a quiet one.*

17.speaker: Narrator
17.text: *One night, a courier arrived with a letter addressed to 'Shadowheart'. A name few call you anymore.*

44.speaker: Narrator
44.text: *It is an invitation to a celebration for those who stood against the Absolute.*

188.speaker: Narrator
188.text: *You waste no time in packing, and set off on the long road back to where all of your adventures together began.*

273.speaker: Narrator
273.text: *It is an invitation to a gathering of the friends and allies who stood by your side in the fight against the Absolute.*

239.speaker: Narrator
239.text: *Only six months have passed since the defeat of the Absolute, but Baldur's Gate is already recovering.*

42.speaker: Narrator
42.text: *Wyll has personally handled the rebuilding of the city, and the recovery of its people. The scars run deep, but Baldur's Gate will wear them proudly.*

63.speaker: Narrator
63.text: *The city was the battleground for a fight that decided the fate of Faerûn, and you and Wyll were on the frontline.*

235.speaker: Narrator
235.text: *Now, matters of state take up much of Wyll's time, and he turns down more invitations to parties and balls than you ever thought possible.*

151.speaker: Narrator
151.text: *But one day he comes to you with a sparkle in his eye, holding an invitation that neither of you could ever refuse.*

220.speaker: Narrator
220.text: *A gathering for those who rose to the cause against the Absolute - an invitation to return to where your adventures began.*

125.speaker: Narrator
125.text: *A gathering of the friends and allies who stood with you in that great battle - an invitation to return to where your adventures began.*

278.speaker: Narrator
278.text: *In the six months since the Netherbrain fell, you haven't left Baldur's Gate.*

29.speaker: Narrator
29.text: *The city needs Grand Duke Ravengard more than ever. The city needs you.*

265.speaker: Narrator
265.text: *Your pride in the citizens humbles you. In the wake of the Absolute's horror, they have come together to rebuild and to shelter one another.*

179.speaker: Narrator
179.text: *But tonight you are parted from them, briefly, for you have received an invitation that you cannot refuse.*

293.speaker: Narrator
293.text: *Tonight you will celebrate those who stood against the Absolute, and honour their sacrifices.*

281.speaker: Narrator
281.text: *Tonight you will meet with your friends and allies, those who stood with you in the fight against the Absolute, and you will remember.*

280.speaker: Narrator
280.text: *You have made a fortress in the Underdark, with Astarion and other outcast vampire spawn. It is not civilised, it is not safe, but it is home.*

155.speaker: Narrator
155.text: *Few know how to find you, and most that do are unwelcome, so when a message arrives, addressed to you both, you fear the worst.*

164.speaker: Narrator
164.text: *Hunters, killers, tormentors. But you need not fear - this letter is an invitation, and it comes from a friend.*

177.speaker: Narrator
177.text: *An invitation, written in a frail hand, inviting you to a celebration for those who stood against the Absolute.*

85.speaker: Narrator
85.text: *Written in a frail hand, it requests your presence at a gathering of your former allies. Those who stood with you against the Absolute.*

52.speaker: Narrator
52.text: *The journey to the surface is long and perilous, but you would not miss this for the world.*

192.speaker: Narrator
192.text: *Cutting through the dreadful buzz of the wasps and the screams of the damned, a familiar, comforting voice echoed in your mind - Withers.*

208.speaker: Narrator
208.text: *He requested your attendance in Faerun - a chance to reflect on your triumph over the Absolute.*

50.speaker: Narrator
50.text: *He requested your attendance in Faerun, to gather with your friends and allies, those who stood against the Absolute at your side.*

98.speaker: Narrator
98.text: *The overbearing heat, the ever-looming threat of Zariel's forces - you've been seeking any chance for respite.*

138.speaker: Narrator
138.text: *This was just the stroke of luck you needed. Life is looking up.*

266.speaker: Narrator
266.text: *It was hardly a tenday since you finally confronted Mizora, but you've been searching for a way out of Avernus ever since.*
